PERSONA:
meet john james o'connor, a 68-year-old retired high school history teacher, living in the metropolitan area of hartford, connecticut, in the northeast region of the united states. born and raised in the united states, john is a white non-hispanic man who identifies as a roman catholic. he and his wife, margaret, have been married for 45 years and are proud parents of two grown children, both of whom have moved out and are building their own families.

john holds an associate's degree in education from a local community college, which he obtained in 1978. after serving in the u.s. navy for four years, he decided to dedicate his life to teaching, imparting his knowledge and love for american history to generations of high school students. he worked at hartford high school for over 30 years before retiring in 2015.

john's household income is around $45,000 per year, which comes from his pension and margaret's part-time job as a librarian at a local library. they have a modest home in a suburban neighborhood, which they bought in 1985 for $120,000. the value of their home has increased over the years, and it is now worth around $250,000. john and his wife own their home outright, with no mortgage.

john is a devoted catholic and attends mass more than once a week at their local parish, where he is also involved in the knights of columbus. he values his faith and believes it plays an essential role in guiding his decisions, including those related to politics.

as a self-described conservative, john identifies as a republican and leans towards supporting conservative policies. he is registered to vote and has voted in every presidential election since 1976. john's conservative views are shaped by his upbringing, faith, and life experiences. he believes in individual responsibility, limited government intervention in economic matters, and a strong national defense.

john's use of the internet is limited to a few times a week, mainly for checking email, news, and occasional online shopping. he does not volunteer his time to any organizations, as he prefers to focus on his family and personal hobbies, such as gardening and reading historical novels.

john's economic concerns center around maintaining his pension benefits, accessing quality healthcare, and reducing the national debt. he is also worried about the impact of taxation on his household income and the ability of future generations to achieve the american dream.
